meanings.sent1: She ran sixtyfold faster than her brother.
meanings.sent2: The car sped sixtyfold down the highway.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel climbed the tree sixtyfold quicker than the cat.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass sixtyfold slower during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The music blared sixtyfold louder than before.

meanings.definition: Sixty times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: He had a sixtyfold increase in his savings.
meanings.sent2: The giant pumpkin weighed a sixtyfold amount compared to the small ones.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with sixtyfold more sprinkles than necessary.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was sixtyfold brighter after receiving the good news.
meanings.sent5: The tree's shadow stretched sixtyfold longer as the sun set.

meanings.definition: To increase or grow to sixty times the original amount.
meanings.sent1: They hoped to sixtyfold their profits by the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden sixtyfolded in size after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally sixtyfolded the amount of salt in the soup.
meanings.sent4: His excitement sixtyfolded when he saw the surprise party guests.
meanings.sent5: The population of the town sixtyfolded in just a few years.
